Spread.Views uses Data Analysis Expression(DAX) language to perform calculations. DAX is a formula language that allows you to define custom calculations. It includes some of the functions which are used in Excel formulas and additional functions that are designed to work with aggregation.

While calculated fields and calculated columns are similar since both are formula based, they only differ in where and how they are used.
Calculated Columns are used when you want to treat the calculated results of a formula as one singe column, where as the Calculated Field just define a formula that can be used out of a column.
